entry.title: Revert "media: Generate report when Cdm reads file > 40KB"
entry.content:
This reverts commit caa53e80d21a1485453bdf93b30d5d26d8bde337.



Reason for revert: We see crashes on the crash portal and we don't want

to promote this to stable, so we need to revert this CL.



Original change's description:

> media: Generate report when Cdm reads file > 40KB

>

> Use DumpWithoutCrashing to generate a report when a file that is over

> 40 KB is read by the CDM. The origin is already reported for all crashes

> so all that is needed to be done is to "fake crash" when > 40 KB.

>

> Tested it by changing the if condition to if(file_size_bytes > 0), and

> used the Integration Console to generate a crash.

>

> I then locally viewed the crash report using

> ```

> .\strings64.exe .\c2178a18-c44d-432b-9ca3-94e8cdb6c69b.dmp | grep -C2 excessive

> ```

>

> and saw

>

> ```

> cdm-origin

> https://integration.staging.widevine.com

> ```

>

> Bug: b/310029102, 325331239

> Change-Id: I612a6ef0dace14ee91d47a04edb3b9ec39345ebb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273700

> Commit-Queue: Vikram Pasupathy

> Reviewed-by: Xiaohan Wang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260844}



Bug: b/310029102, 325331239

entry.title: Use scope-based InSequence in test expectations
entry.content:
These tests were doing `.InSequence(s)` on every expectations to

check API call ordering. This would be useful if multiple independent

sequences had to be checked in parallel, but it's not the case here.

It's less verbose to use a stack-based `InSequence` object. It's

also safer because it's easy to forget to include an `.InSequence(s)`

on some expectations (which was the case in a few tests, and which led to incorrectly ordered expectations).



Bug: 40249439, 326503102

entry.title: Fix CpuProbeManager crash on non-desktop platforms
entry.content:
CpuProbeManager is crashing because PressureManagerImpl is incorrectly

checking if cpu_probe_manager_ is null [1], instead of the CpuProbe that

cpu_probe_manager_ owns. As a result, on non-desktop platforms where

CpuProbe is nullptr, the check incorrectly passes and so

CpuProbeManager::EnsureStarted() is called, which crashes attempting to

call CpuProbe::StartSampling on the nullptr.



This CL changes PressureManagerImpl to use a factory to instantialize

CpuProbeManager, that will return a nullptr when the underlying CpuProbe

is nullptr. This way PressureManagerImpl doesn't need to know about

CpuProbe, and can keep using the current check.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/device/compute_pressure/pressure_manager_impl.cc;l=66



Bug: 326491562

Change-Id: I1bfcd1026c62188147759d87274d55ca32d7a438

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319960

Reviewed-by: Raphael Kubo Da Costa

Reviewed-by: Colin Blundell

Commit-Queue: Charles Meng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1265408}

entry.title: Expand gfx::OverlayTransform
entry.content:
Add missing OverlayTransform enums:

OVERLAY_TRANSFORM_FLIP_VERTICAL_CLOCKWISE_90

OVERLAY_TRANSFORM_FLIP_VERTICAL_CLOCKWISE_270



Key methods are:

GetOverlayTransform in overlay_candidate_factory.cc

GetSwapBuffersSize in skia_output_device_buffer_queue.cc

Methods in overlay_transform_utils.cc

OverlayTransformToWindowTransform in android_surface_control_compat.cc



The rest is plumbing:

* Only enable the new enums for overlay for android surface control

* Add enums to switch statements though they should all be NOTREACHED

* Mojo serialization



Note viz should use these new enums for android surface control only.

All other configurations (eg wayland) are indeed NOTREACHED. Support

can be added after manually verifying mapping from new OverlayTransform

to platform-specific enums are correct.

> Revert "[infra] Consolidate mb gen/isolate behaviour"

entry.title: Add a PrintTo function to print PaintOp objects in test expectations
entry.content:
This is needed for GoogleTest to correctly print PaintOp instances in

test expectation failure messages. PrintTo is declared in paint_op.h,

to remove risks of ODR voilations (see https://abseil.io/tips/99).

It's defined in paint_op_helper.cc though, because this code is not

meant to be included in non-test production builds.

entry.title: launcher: Fix crash in TopIconAnimationView
entry.content:
Don't update icon background layer color if layer was not created.

Depending on whether the animation view animates an icon that's shown

within the folder icon or not, the icon background may not have a layer.

When animating a view that doesn't animate into the folder icon, the

background color does not animate differently from the rest of the icon

so no extra layer is needed, so the layer does not exist.



BUG=b/325103208

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Deflake some InterestGroupBrowserTests.
entry.content:
navigator.runAdAuction() has default script timeouts of 50 ms. This is

not long enough on memory bots (and timing may be a bit tight on debug

builds, too, or even on release bots).



This CL migrates InterestGroupBrowserTests that use maybePromise()

from calling navigator.runAdAuction() directly to using

RunAuctionAndWait() and RunAuctionAndWaitForUrl().



This CL also introduces MaybePromiseFunction() to make the tests a

little simpler, and does some minor cleanup of the tests it touches.

entry.title: Refactor VrUiHost lifetime
entry.content:
Currently, the VrUiHost is intended to be created when a device runtime

is added, and will live as long as that runtime does. However, this adds

a lot of additional complexity to the VrUiHost's internal state. It also

leads to a somewhat weird lifetime management, where the

ChromeXrIntegrationClient is responsible for creating and maintaining a

separate reference to the VrUiHost code. Further, the plumbing to allow

a VrUiHost to be created only exists for the windows-specific

IsolatedXrDeviceProvider, meaning that to enable overlays on Android, we

have to find an alternate route for creating a VrUiHost.



This change moves the VrUiHost to be created/destroyed alongside the

session. This allows for simplifying some of the logic in the class

since it doesn't need to worry about existing across the span of

multiple sessions. This also removes the need for two of the

BrowserXRRuntime observer methods that it was subscribing to, as the

things they were used for can now be done during construction (via new

arguments) and destruction. The remaining BrowserXRRuntime observer

method that VrUiHostImpl used can simply be moved to the class

definition, since it was the only class that overrode that method. This

further contributes to simplifying the lifespan for the VrUiHostImpl.



Finally, since the VrUiHostImpl is now created alongside the session,

we no longer need the XRCompositorHost to provide the ImmersiveOverlay

to the session and can simply supply the ImmersiveOverlay directly when

creating the session.



This change also defines the VrUiHost base class and creation method for

all platforms, since future work in this area to enable Overlays on

Android will require that. There are still a couple of Windows-specific

things that the VrUiHostImpl and their children do (apart from simply

needing an Android-compatible GraphicsDelegate), so for the time being,

Chrome's actual implementation of that method is left to be basically

windows-specific. This will minimize the need for future changes, since

the BrowserXrRuntimeImpl will already need to handle the VrUiHost not

existing, since there are currently no plans to create one for every

runtime type (e.g. ARCore).



Bug: 40901055

Change-Id: I2bbb7b085c689eab6b4e8861d41b44aff627baeb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5304598

Reviewed-by: Chris Bookholt

Reviewed-by: Piotr Bialecki

Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

Auto-Submit: Alexander Cooper

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

entry.title: Add a new helper, ToResolvedPromise<>, for immediately creating a resolved and typed ScriptPromise
entry.content:
Currently, creating an already-resolved promise requires the caller

to convert their resolve value to a v8::Value or ScriptValue.

ToResolvedPromise requires an explicit IDL type, and will access

any value that can be converted to that IDL type via ToV8Traits.

entry.title: Deduplicate recent searches and query tile suggestions to query tiles.
entry.content:
This change enables the deduplication logic to match the query tiles

against recently executed searches and deduplicate them to the query

tile item.



The deduplication logic processes raw URL in a case-sensitive way to

determine whether two URLs are equivalent.



The direction of deduplication is determined by the suggestion

relevance: suggestions with higher relevance absorb duplicates with

lower relevance.

entry.title: [Fuchsia] Manual update fuchsia_version to remove "version:" prefix
entry.content:
The updated skia config http://review.skia.org/817336 removed the

"version:" prefix from its generated content, so it started searching

for the tag string with a "version:" prefix in the cipd. I.e. it

considers the current version string as the tag value rather the

`tag:value` pair.



So this change manually adjusts the DEPS file to match the latest

configuration, so the skia autoroller can be started again. Now it's not

even trying because of the string mismatch.

entry.title: cc: Split TileManager memory UMAs per process
entry.content:
The Compositing.TileManager.*Memory UMAs are useful for visualizing

how often compositor memory limits are exceeded. However, this UMA

does not distinguish between whether the compositor lives in the

browser process or a renderer process. This is important for CrOS

because all of Ash (e.g. the system UI) is rasterized in the browser

process, and we would benefit from the additional breakdown.



This CL splits the TileManager UMAs into separate Browser and

Renderer metrics.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Compositing.TileManager.* is replaced per-process by

Compositing.TileManager.*.{ProcessType}



Bug: b:250988547

Change-Id: Ia4667214afdf91546d9e5e03c2e5ba0e81eca523

entry.title: Better handle focus changes in task title textfield
entry.content:
Fixes a crash when tabbing out of the task title textfield (when editing

or adding the task). The crash was occurring because the focus manager

is not handling the case where the blurred view gets deleted mid focus

change. To avoid this, the task UI removal is scheduled asynchronously.



Keeps the task view in editing state if the focus

moves to the "Edit in browser" button (so the button can be focused from

the textfield). The logic to exit the edit task state is adapted to keep

the view in edit state as long as either the "Edit in browser" or the

task title textfield are focused. Deactivating the textfield still

commits the task changes.



Don't disable check button while saving an edited, or creating task, to

allow focus move from the title textfield to the check button (as

disabling the check button will make it unfocusable).



BUG=b/324409607,b/324544407,b/321789324



Change-Id: I9cdf22d664e8a2cc21666f71457ef4e05a4b5fea

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318622

entry.title: Call SafeBrowsing API on startup.
entry.content:
Similar to how we init SafetyNet API (https://crrev.com/c/3679538),

make a call to SafeBrowsing API on startup before the first lookup

request to reduce the latency of subsequent requests. Since

SafeBrowsing API doesn't expose initSafeBrowsing, call the lookupUri

function with an empty URL instead. Use an empty URL so that it

doesn't send a real request to Safe Browsing server.



Tested locally. Restart and kill Chrome repeated for 20 times, the

average latency logged in

Startup.Android.Cold.FirstSafeBrowsingApiResponseTime.Tabbed reduced

from 264ms to 91ms.



This is controlled via a new feature flag

SafeBrowsingCallNewGmsApiOnStartup. It is disabled by default.



Bug: 40935425,b/314272272

entry.title: [//gpu] Have GetTextureTarget() check for SI being overlay candidate
entry.content:
This CL changes ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferUsage) to

return `GL_TEXTURE_2D` if the SharedImage instance in question is not an

overlay candidate (i.e., it does not have SCANOUT in its usage). This

will enable us to remove equivalent client-side checks as we convert

clients that create SharedImages *not* explicitly backed by native

buffers from using gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget() to calling

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget().



NOTE: There are no callers of this method at this point, so this CL does

not have any behavioral impact.

entry.title: [ios] Create MagicStackCollectionViewController
entry.content:
This is a UICollectionView implementation of the Magic Stack using

a DiffableDataSource. MagicStackLayoutConfigurator manages the

compositional layout for this UICollectionView. EditButtonConfig/Cell

represent the edit button at the end of the Magic Stack and is its own

NSCollectionLayoutSection after the section containing the cards.



The one change in experience between the layout is that when focusing

a middle module, there is no longer peeking on both sides, only the

right. The default behavior was difficult to achieve since the

UICollectionView will not render cells outside of its bounds, so by

following the current layoutGuide for the Magic Stack, the module would

be too narrow if we wanted to make enough space for the left and

right module to be rendered. This could be rectified later by making

the moduleLayoutGuide wider for this implementation.



iphone: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1whU7hv13rYPgZ9twRr9yPcpevoOlp9X7/view?usp=sharing

iPad: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dtJI7YfL6UM4UGm58jll_Fq4Gjd9aX0u/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: [Cert Provisioning] Destroy cert scheduler on service shutdown
entry.content:
Previously, cert provisioning keyed service did not have shutdown and

was destroying itself with destructor and not Shutdown. The cert service

depends on invalidation service which is destroyed on Shutdown and

expects its dependants to do the same.



For example, invalidation service expects InvalidationHandlers

to unregister before the service is shutdown, thus handlers must

unregister on Shutdown. Before this change, cert invalidators were

unregistering on destruction, which happens after shutdown and were

breaking order and causing crashes.



Now, the whole cert provisioning stack is destroyed on service shutdown

before service destruction.



CertProvisioningAsh uses the service and outlives it, as it was before,

without any breaks.



Bug: chromium:40070281

Test: manual + existing unit tests

Change-Id: I6a5030e17104d4bffb5f6c09a3fd67083049687e

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Deflake some InterestGroupBrowserTests.
entry.content:
navigator.runAdAuction() has default script timeouts of 50 ms. This is

not long enough on memory bots (and timing may be a bit tight on debug

builds, too, or even on release bots). This CL migrates simpler

InterestGroupBrowserTests that call navigator.runAdAuction() directly

to using RunAuctionAndWait() and RunAuctionAndWaitForUrl().



"Simpler" in this context means tests that call EvalJs with a function

that only calls "await navigator.runAdAuction({...})", with no extra

Javascript, as the RunAuctionAndWait() family of methods only take the

"{...}" value as an argument, and no additional JS.



This CL also updates RunAuctionAndNavigateFencedFrame() to increase

timeouts just like RunAuctionAndWait() does, though perhaps they should

be updated to use a shared helper.



More complicated tests will be fixed in followup CLs.



Bug: 324713537

entry.title: views: Add some crash keys
entry.content:
It seems that in `View::OrphanLayers()`, `GetLayersInOrder()`

may return a layer that is not a sibling of the current view's

layer, thus trying to remove it from the view's parent layer

results in a crash.



It's hard to know which layer/view/widget it is due to ICF

(Identical Code Folding), so adding these ccrash keys may

allow us to have some insights.

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Triggering code for the post migration sheet
entry.content:
Post migration sheet should be triggered on the next startup after the

password migration has finished.

A new pref is added to indicate that the sheet should be shown. It's

false by default and should be set to true by the migration algorithm.

When the sheet is shown, the pref will be set to false and the sheet

will not show up again. That will be done in the follow-up CL on the

Java side because we want to be sure that the sheet UI was actually

shown.

entry.title: [//media] Make RasterInterfaceInVideoResourceUpdater Android-only
entry.content:
The new codepath landed enabled-by-default on platforms other than

Android in 119 [1] (on Android it did so only in 123 [2]). This CL moves

the killswitch to being Android-only, making the new codepath

unconditional on all other platforms.



The concrete motivation for doing this now is to unblock followup

simplifications in VizTransportProcessFactory, which is not used on

Android [3], by removing the dependence on this killswitch being enabled

there.



[1] https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/b7c5afd44c88ff27ad015378b7dd620fb3fba629

[2] https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/fef2d15708cf5e482e30837a1a41164ba9930156

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/BUILD.gn;l=3352-3361?q=viz_process_transport_factory.cc&ss=chromium

entry.title: [gbb-cct] Move getting surface renderer to background thread.
entry.content:
In local debugging I see this taking in excess of 100ms. It doesn't have to happen on the UI thread, so it makes sense to move it to a background thread. And now we're doing it on background thread it can happen immediately after data is loaded, rather than waiting for trigger conditions (e.g. not in motion) to be met.

entry.title: view-transition: Fix rendering of elements with clip-path on descendants
entry.content:
The visual overflow rect computation code in ViewTransition assumes that

if an element has a clip-path, its content will be sized to the bounds

of that clip-path. The clip-path extent can be larger than the contents

of that element.



The above assumption is only true if the element with the clip-path is

layerized. Otherwise the size of the overflow is an intersection of the

element's painted content with the clip-path. This leads to incorrect

overflow calculation for an element's overflow rect when its not

layerized.



Fix the above by forcing layerization on descendants of a named element

if it has a clip-path. This is easier than knowing whether the content

will be layerized by the paint step later.



Fixed: 324585402

Change-Id: Id35cf3aab2cb4e9f0d27dbe36afeaf37789d95dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5322398

entry.title: FaceGaze: Use third_party/ mediapipe files
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/5302076 added mediapipe files to third_party/.

This change pulls those files into the FaceGaze build so that

we can run FaceGaze without a custom build argument. Doing this allows

devs/testers to use FaceGaze on a canary build without having to

deploy a custom version of Chrome. This opens FaceGaze up to UXR

possibilities and overall simplifies the development flow.



A few changes worth noting:

1. We use path mappings to point to third_party/.../vision.d.ts to

ensure the TS build works

2. Files needed at runtime are copied from third_party/ to the

accessibility_common extension directory

3. We remove several files from mediapipe_task_vision.tar.xz since

they are now checked-in to third_party/. We also update the .wasm file

that is contained within the archive to the latest version so that it

stays in sync with the .js file in third_party/.



Bug: b:309121742

Change-Id: I602513ba7419626a084707c4c3c0bf1d59dab7e3

entry.title: [Autofill] Eliminate initiating element in ApplyFormAction()
entry.content:
This CL removes the parameter of initiating_element parameter

from ApplyFormAction(). The function now assumes that the

currently-focused field is the triggering element instead.



Since the Autofill popup is hidden on focus loss, the two are

the same except in rare circumstances. See the bug for a more

detailed analysis.



The CL is optimized for review. A followup CL simplifies the

function.

entry.title: [FedCM] Allow button flow to replace widget flow
entry.content:
Since button flow implies stronger user login intention of, it should

take precedence over the widget flow. In particular:

1. If there's an in-flight button request, reject any coming widget request

2. If there's an in-flight widget request, replace it with the button request



This patch also fixes an issue where we persisted the rp_mode_ after a

button flow.
